1:
Job resumed speaking and he said,
\q
2:
"As surely as God lives, who has taken away my justice,
\q the Almighty, who made my life bitter,
\q
4:
My lips will not speak wickedness,
\q neither will my tongue speak deceit;
5:
I will never admit that you three are right;
\q until I die I will never deny my integrity.
7:
Let my enemy be like a wicked man;
\q let him who rises up against me be like an unrighteous man.
8:
For what is the hope of a godless man when God cuts him off,
\q when God takes away his life?
\q
9:
Will God hear his cry
\q when trouble comes upon him?
\q
10:
Will he delight himself in the Almighty
\q and call upon God at all times?
12:
See, all of you have seen this yourselves;
\q why then have you spoken all this nonsense?
13:
This is the destiny of a wicked man with God,
\q the heritage of the oppressor that he receives from the Almighty:
\q
14:
If his children multiply, it is for the sword;
\q his offspring will never have enough food.
15:
Those who survive him will be buried by plague,
\q and their widows will make no lament for them.
\q
16:
Though the wicked man heaps up silver like the dust,
\q and heaps up clothing like clay,
\q
17:
he may heap up clothing, but righteous people will put it on,
\q and innocent people will divide up the silver among themselves.
18:
He builds his house like a spider,
\q like a hut that a guard makes.
\q
19:
He lies down in bed rich, but he will not keep doing so;
\q he opens his eyes, and everything is gone.
21:
The east wind carries him away, and he leaves;
\q it sweeps him out of his place.
23:
It claps its hands at him in mockery;
\q it hisses him out of his place.
